Text: #G14# As a Visitor, I want to sign up via github or google, so that that I don't have to enter lots of information and remember my password for yet another website.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to permanently delete a data package, so that that it no longer takes up storage space.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to validate the data I am about to publish to the registry, so that that I publish good data and know that I am doing.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to know that the data I am downloading is good and can be relied on, so that that I don't have to check it myself or run into annoying bugs later on.

#G14# As a Publisher, I want to publish a data package where its resource data is stored on my servers but the registry caches a copy of that data, so that that if my data is lost or gets broken I still have a copy people can use.
Action: Publish A Data Package Resource Data Where Stored On Servers

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to publish a data package in the UI, so that that it is available and published.
Action: Publish A Data Package In The Ui

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to create a data package in the UI so that it is available and published.
Action: Create A Data Package In The Ui

Text: #G14# As a consumer, I want to view the data package, so that that I can get a sense of whether I want this dataset or not.
#G14# As a Publisher, I want to preview a datapackage I have prepared, so that that I can check it works and share the results.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to see some example data packages quickly, so that I get a sense of what is on this site and if it is useful to look further.
#G14# As a Consumer, I want to search based on description of data package, so that that I can find package which related to some key words.
Action: Search On Description Of Data Package

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to download the data package in one file, so that that I don't have to download descriptor and each resource by hand.
Action: Download The Data Package In File

Text: #G14# As a Web Developer, I want to be able to install multiple versions of the same datapackage separately, so that that all my projects could be developed independently and deployed locally.
Action: Install Multiple Versions Of The Same Datapackage

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to version my Data Package and keep multiple versions around including older versions, so that that I do not break consumer systems when I change my datapackage.
Action: Keep Multiple Versions Including Older Versions

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to get a sense of the age of the datapackage that I have downloaded before, so that that I can decide if I should update or not.
Action: Get A Sense Of The Age Of The Datapackage

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to view a Datapackage at a particular version online, so that that I can present/discuss the particular data timeslice of interest with other people.
Action: View A Datapackage At A Online Particular Version

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to be notified of changes to a package I care about, so that that I can check out what has changed and take action.
Action: Notified Of Changes To A Package

Text: #G14# As a Consumer, I want to see a publisher's profile, so that that I can discover their packages and get a sense of how active and good they are.
#G14# As an owner, I want to remove someone from membership in my publisher, so that they no longer have ability to publish or modify my data packages.
Action: Remove Someone From Membership In Publisher

Text: #G14# As a Publisher, I want to have private data packages, so that I can share just with my team.
#G18# As a system administrator, I want to run a script that installs the Neurohub node onto a virgin Ubuntu operating system.
Action: Run A Script Installs The Neurohub

Text: #G18# As an investigator, I want to view the acceptance test results, so that I can understand how feature-complete the Neurohub node currently is.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to create a log book page for an experiment and attach a file to this page.
Action: Create A Log Book Page For An Experiment
Attach A File To This Page

Text: #G18# As a researcher, I want to create a log book page for an experiment and attach a directory that contains multiple files.
Action: Create A Log Book Page For An Experiment
Attach A Directory Contains Multiple Files

Text: #G18# As a researcher, I want to upload files prior to having them attached to a log book page using a mapped network drive.

#G18# As a release engineer, I want to configure nightly builds that automatically perform a Neurohub installation on a virgin operating system, execute tests and report back results, without requiring any manual input/interaction.
Action: Configure Nightly Builds Automatically Perform A Neurohub Installation On A Virgin Operating System
Configure Nightly Builds Automatically Perform A Installation On A Virgin System Requiring Interaction
Configure Nightly Builds Automatically Perform A Neurohub Installation On A Virgin Operating System Requiring Any Manual Input

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to assign bespoke information to a file dependent on its type.
Action: Assign Bespoke Information To A Dependent File On Type

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to make predicated links between files.
#G18# As a user, I want to revert to an older version of an uploaded file.
Action: Revert To An Older Version Of An Uploaded File

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to have a visual way of viewing particular files uploaded over a time period.
Action: Have A Visual Way Viewing Particular Files Over A Time Period

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to associate together files involved in a experiment.
#G18# As a user, I want to modify or branch an experimental protocol, whilst retaining the original.
#G18# As a user, I want to see the provenance of the page as part of the search results.
Action: Attach Multiple Files Once To A Log Book Page

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to draw tables using HTML tags as part of the content of a log book page.
#G18# As a system administrator, I want to migrate data from an older version of NeuroHub to the current version.
Action: Forward Important News Items To An External Mailing List

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to have a spreadsheet hosted within the Neurohub Web page, so that I can edit and calculate costs collaboratively with others while working on the proposal.
Action: Forms Provide With Feedback About The Course That Attended

Text: #G18# As a supervisor, I want to create feedback forms within Neurohub, that my students can fill in and submit, in order to provide me with feedback about the course that they attended.
Action: Push Posted Content To Twitter Feed At The Same Time

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to have the option to tell Neurohub to push posted content to my Twitter feed at the same time.
Action: Share A Private Logbook Entry With Individuals Rather Than Groups

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to either keep a logbook entry private or share it with individuals rather than groups.
Action: Recorded In A Neurohub Log Book Executing A Workflow

Text: #G18# As a user, I want to have the details of the workflow execution to be recorded in a neurohub log book while executing a workflow.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have the ability to insert Greek symbols into my logbook entries.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have electronic support for keeping track of which data sets were used/output/modified as part of a particular experiment.
Action: Provided With A Mechanism Electronically Sharing Papers
Provided With A Mechanism Note With Other Researchers

Text: #G18# As a researcher, I want to have a timeline display of multiple data files and their associated images, so that I can compare the data taken from experiments on particular dates.
Action: Have Remote Access To Data For Site Off Working

Text: #G18# As a researcher, I want to have the system to provide standard metadata, that all researchers in the centre (and beyond) can use, so that we can better understand each others' data.
#G18# As a researcher, I want to have physiology images to be annotated with standard meta data, so that my data can later be searched for and understood.
Action: Attach Standard Meta Data For Behavioural Observations

Text: #G18# As a researcher, I want to have at least some meta data to be automatically inserted when new data is added to the system.
Action: Attach Detailed Meta Data To The Data

Text: #G18# As a researcher, I want to have the ability to form links between objects, for example File A is an analysis of File B, so that data can be searched by type and by association.

#G18# As a researcher, I want to have any data that I have written to the VRE to be protected from modification or deletion, so that original data can always be traced back to an experiment and a point in time.

#G18# As a researcher, I want to associate meta data to the group as a whole at some point in time after the bulk upload has completed, so that I have a period of time to reflect on suitable values for the meta data.
Action: Change The Sharing Of Multiple Files

Text: #G18# As a researcher,  I want to have the ability to locate and access data that colleagues want to share.
Action: Have The To Ability With A Revision Control System

Text: #G18# As a JuniorResearcher,  I want to have the ability to harvest knowledge from within the group, so that I can learn from more experienced researchers.
Action: Secure Remote Access To The Neurohub Node When Away Working From The Laboratory

Text: #G22# As a PI, I want to properly record all metadata, so that I can ensure proper running of the project in case of staff changes.
#G22# As a researcher, I want to import metadata that I captured with a metadata tool, so that I do not have to capture it again in a DMP.
Action: That Captured With A Metadata Tool

Text: #G22# As a PI, I want to plan what kind of data I want to record/store, so that I can ensure it will possible to store it.
#G22# As a PI, I want to record information about my DMP, so that an Ethics Committee can review this for compliance with ethical standards.
#G22# As an archivemanager, I want to know the legal status of data, so that I can apply the legal requirements accordingly.
Action: Know The Legal Status Of Data

Text: #G22# As a data manager, I want to know which kind of data types will be produced or collected, so that I can determine what basic support services and functionalities are required.
#G22# As an IT staff member, I want to know which kind of data types will be produced or collected, so that I can determine what basic support services and functionalities are required.
#G22# As an archivemanager, I want to know in advance the conservation period of data, so that I can better organize the service by adapting the preservation actions.
Action: Know In Advance The Conservation Period Of Data

Text: #G22# As a data manager, I want to document all rights necessary for managing the data, so that I can curate and preserve the data.
Action: Document All Necessary Rights Managing The Data

Text: #G22# As a research head, I want to access to the persistent identifiers of datasets provided in the DMP, so that I can check that the DMP has been implemented.
Action: Access To The Persistent Identifiers Of Datasets In The Dmp

Text: #G22# As a stakeholder, I want to know who is responsible for the DMP, so that I can ask them about further details.
#G22# As a metadata manager, I want to have a short description of project, so that I can be informed about the metadata description.
Action: Have A Short Description Of Project

Text: #G22# As a rector, I want to know how many data will be stored, so that I can plan long term resources.
#G22# As a data manager, I want to know the time plan for collecting data, so that I can plan the data management.
Action: Know The Time Plan Collecting Data

Text: #G22# As an archivemanager, I want to reuse the information regarding file format, so that I can apply automated checks for the file validation.
Action: Reuse The Information Regarding File Format

Text: #G22# As a researcher, I want to extract the description of the data collected, so that I can reuse it for the writing of a data paper.
Action: Extract The Description Of The Data

Text: #G22# As a researcher, I want to link research publications in the institutional repository or CRIS with DMP records, so that I can generate reports of research output resulting from a project.
Action: Link Research Publications In The Institutional Repository With Dmp Records

Text: #G22# As a repository operator, I want to know about the kind of data, so that I can evaluate the storage size and system.
Action: Know About The Kind Of Data

Text: #G22# As a Director of Research Integrity, I want to access reports containing details of research projects in which data are classified as sensitive or highly sensitive, so that I can confirm security protocols are applied to these data.
Action: Contain Details Of Research Projects In Which Data Classified As Sensitive
Contain Details Of Projects In Which Data Classified As Highly Sensitive

Text: #G22# As an IT staff member, I want to know with which software or technology the data is produced or used, so that I can determine what kind of technical services and functionalities are required.

#G22# As a data manager, I want to know which information is necessary to re-use the data, so that it can be checked whether all necessary information is available for researchers interested in re-using the data.
#G22# As a data manager, I want to know whether the data can be reproduced efficiently, so that I can determine whether and how the data has to be stored.
#G22# As a data manager, I want to know the security requirements of the data, so that I can check whether the data can be kept secure.
Action: Know The Security Requirements Of The Data

Text: #G22# As a researcher, I want to see the sections on roles submitted by other researchers in my department, so that I can see if we could share data manager posts.
Action: See The Sections On Roles Other Researchers In Department

Text: #G22# As a researcher, I want to record my intention to share data I have collected under terms of a particular licence, so that other researchers who use the data understand the rights of use.
Action: Collected Under Terms Of A Particular Licence

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to assign a component unique identifier to a Resource Component.
Action: Assign A Unique, Component Identifier To A Resource Component

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to associate a standard identifier string with a Subject heading.
Action: Associate A Identifier, Standard String With A Subject Heading

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to see Dates and Extents displayed in both the read and edit views for Accessions and/or Resources before the list of Subjects.
Action: See Dates In Both The Read Views For Accessions Before The List Of Subjects
See Dates In Both The Read Views Resource

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to import Agent information from EAC-CPF records.
Action: Import Agent Information From Eac Cpf Records

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to import only Agent and Subject information from MARCXML records.
Action: Import Only Agent From Marcxml Records

Text: #G23# As an Application Administrator, I want to assign Users to an Advanced Data Entry and ensure that the appropriate permissions are enforced.
Action: Assign Users To An Advanced Data Entry

Text: #G23# As a user, I want to add additional properties for repositories.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to add Notes to other record types.
Action: Add Notes To Other Record Types

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to assign a Level of description to a Resource or Resource Component and optionally specify another value if the Level is not in a predefined list.
Action: Assign A Level Of Description To Resource Component
Assign A Level Of Description To A Resource

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to import EAD files that were exported by the Archivists' Toolkit.
Action: Import Ead Files Exported The Archivists' Toolkit

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to create and edit Event records.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to upload an EAD for import from within the frontend application.
Action: Upload An Ead For Import Within The Frontend Application

Text: #G23# As an Archivist, I want to import EAD data.
#G23# As a Developer , I want to develop a custom importer.
#G23# As a Repository Manager , I want to create, update and delete any records in my repository.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to create and edit Agent records.
#G23# As an Archivist, I want to associate a Subject record with a Resource description.
Action: Associate A Subject Record With A Resource Description

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to have a user interface that is familiar to me, so that I feel like all the University systems are joined up.
Action: Have A User Interface Is Familiar To

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit and maintain datasets through Pure, so that I have a single onestop shop for managing my research outputs.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit and maintain datasets through Virtual Research Environments and other workflow tools, so that I can continue to work with tools with which I'm familiar.
Action: Deposit Datasets Through Workflow, Other Tool
Deposit Datasets Through Virtual Research Environments
Maintain Datasets Through Virtual Research Environments
Maintain Datasets Through Workflow, Other Tool

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to deposit the files that I have, so that I don't have to spend a lot of time finding the right version and converting to the right format.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to place data under an embargo, so that my right of first use is protected, and I can fulfil my confidentiality responsibilities.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to allow my collaborators privileged access to datasets, so that we continue to have a productive relationship.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to attach subject specific discoverability metadata to records, so that researchers in my discipline can find my data more easily.
#G24# As a depositor, I want to link datasets with the project DMP, so that compliance with DMP can be demonstrated and whole project workflow is linked together.
Action: Link Datasets With The Project Dmp

Text: #G24# As a depositor, I want to manage multiple versions of the same dataset, so that changes to the dataset are transparent and do not compromise research integrity.
Action: Manage Multiple Versions Of The Same Dataset

Text: #G24# As a data reuser, I want to access the system in my native language, so that I am not put off reusing University of Bath data by language barriers.
Action: Access The System In Native Language

Text: #G24# As a data reuser, I want to view a DOI for a dataset, so that I can get back to the data in future and I can import the dataset into my referencemanagement software automatically.
Action: View A Doi For A Dataset

Text: #G24# As a data reuser, I want to get a persistent URL for a dataset, so that I can get back to the data in future.
Action: Get A Persistent Url For A Dataset

Text: #G24# As a Research Information manager, I want to include records for externally held data complete, so that the university's record of data holdings is complete.
Action: Include Records For Externally Held Data Complete

Text: #G24# As a Research Information manager, I want to track citation counts for published datasets, so that impact of datasets within academia can be demonstrated.
Action: Track Citation Counts For Published Datasets

Text: #G24# As a Research Information manager, I want to segment the view and download statistics by country and sector so that impact of datasets outside academia can be demonstrated.
#G24# As a Research Information manager, I want to have datasets linked to metadata about projects, so that I can report on projects depositing datasets in relation to funder requirements.
Action: Have Datasets To Metadata About Projects

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to know all the collections and objects in the DAMS for which I have custodial responsibility.
Action: Know The Collections In The Dams

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to say one collection is related to another collection.
#G25# As a repository manager, I want to describe a collection, including its title, it's inclusive / bulk dates, its language(s), and many other aspects.
Action: Describe A Collection Including Inclusive Date

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to indicate other descriptions of the collection that are outside the DAMS and of probable importance to users.
Action: Indicate Other Descriptions Of The Collection Are Of Probable Importance To Users
Indicate Other Descriptions Of The Collection Are Outside The Dams

Text: #G25# As a user, I want to be able to browse by collections in the DAMS.
Action: Browse By Collections In The Dams

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to indicate subjects that are related to an object.
Action: Indicate Subjects Related To An Object

Text: #G25# As a user, I want to know about other versions of the object or its metadata that might be of use to me.
Action: Know About Other Versions Of The Object Be Of Use To
Know About Other Versions Of Metadata

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to represent the physical and/or logical structure of an object.
Action: Represent The Physical Structure Of An Object

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to list all the components, in their appropriate order, for an object.
Action: List The Components In Appropriate Order For An Object

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to describe each component as necessary, including title, date(s), language(s), and other facets.
Action: Necessary Describe Each Component Including Title

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to indicate if other rights pertain to the component, apart from the object as a whole.
Action: Indicate Apart Other Rights Pertain To The Component From The Object As A Whole

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to know all events occurring to a component over its life cycle.
Action: Know All Events To A Component Over Life Cycle

Text: #G25# As a user, I want to be able to see and navigate the component hierarchy of an object.
Action: See The Component Hierarchy Of An Object
Navigate The Component Hierarchy Of An Object

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to know all the content files in the DAMS for my repository's objects.
Action: Know The Content Files In The Dams For Repository's Objects

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to associate a content file with either an object or an object component.
Action: Associate A File With An Object Component
Associate A Content File With An Object

Text: #G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to indicate to preservation managers the checksum and checksum method for each master file for a given object.
Action: Indicate To Preservation Managers The Checksum Method For Each Master File For A Given Object

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to provide a title, in all useful forms, for my repository's collections, objects, and object components.
Action: Provide A Title In All Useful Forms For Object
Provide A Title In All Useful Forms For Repository's Collections
Provide A Title In All Useful Forms For Object Component

Text: #G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to present collections, objects, and object components by title.
#G25# As a user, I want to know for an object or its component parts the place of publication, the publisher, etc.
Action: Know For The Place Of Publication The Publisher
Know For An Object The Place Of Publication
Know For The Place Of The Etc
Know For The Place Of Publication The Etc

Text: #G25# As a user, I want to scope my searches for collections, objects, or object components to a specific language.
Action: Object Components To A Specific Language

Text: #G25# As a repository manager, I want to indicate that a name pertinent to a collection, object, or object component has a specific role, such as illustrator, photographer, etc.
#G25# As a user, I want to scope by searches by name to a specific role such as illustrator, photographer, etc.
Action: Scope By Searches By Name To A Specific Role Such As Etc
Scope By Searches By Name To A Specific Role Such As Illustrator
Scope By Searches By Name To A Specific Role Such As Photographer

Text: #G25# As a user, I want to see the geographical context of a collection, object, or object component, where pertinent.
Action: See The Geographical Context Of Object
See The Geographical Context Of Object Component
See The Geographical Context Of A Collection

Text: #G25# As a user, I want to know of all other pertinent versions or descriptions of the resource.
Action: Know Of All Pertinent, Other Versions Of The Resource

Text: #G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know, via the preservation manager, of all files for which the checksum has changed since last registered.
Action: Know Via The Preservation Manager Of All Files For Which The Checksum Has Changed Since Last Registered

Text: #G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know all the statutes pertinent to an object or object component.
Action: Know The Pertinent Statutes To An Object
Know The Pertinent Statutes To Object Component

Text: #G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know when the application of a statute to an object or object component has been modified, either manually or automatically.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know if an object or object component is subject to a library policy that restricts access in any way.
Action: Know An Object Subject To A Library Policy Restricts Access In Any Way

Text: #G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to know if application of a library policy to an object or object component has been modified, either manually or automatically.
#G25# As a DAMS manager, I want to track all events scheduled for recording in the DAMS.
Action: Track All Events For Recording In The Dams

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to restrict a group of files from view.
Action: Restrict A Group Of Files From View

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to set a date on which restrictions will be removed from a file, so that that I don't have to update this by hand.
Action: Set A Date On Which Restrictions Removed From A File

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to select existing rights statuses and statements, so that I can easily create uniform rights statements.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to redact information in digital files for a period of time, so that I can provide access to non-sensitive portions of a record.
Action: Redact Information In Digital Files For A Period Of Time

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to have an online form for licensing archival material, so that the process is more transparent and some of the back and forth can be eliminated.
Action: Have An Online Form Licensing Archival Material

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to automatically generate technical metadata, so that I know the file size.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to link electronic versions of researchers' publications to citations, so that I can share them with other researchers.
Action: Link Electronic Versions Of Researchers' Publications To Citations

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to automatically create access derivatives of digital objects, so that I don't have to do this manually.
Action: Create Access Derivatives Of Digital Objects

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to automatically assign unique identifiers to material I scan, so that I avoid potential errors.
#G26# As a donor representative, I want to supply incremental accruals to new and existing collections, so that material can be transferred on an ongoing basis.
Action: Supply Incremental Accruals To New Collections

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to manage loan documentation, including preservation photos, forms and correspondence, so that I can find it easily later.
Action: Manage Loan Documentation Including Preservation Photos

Text: #G26# As a researcher, I want to generate structured citation data, so that so I can cite a file in a publication.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to share a link to a file on social media, so that so I can show other people an interesting thing I found.
Action: Share A Link To A File On Social Media

Text: #G26# As a researcher, I want to locate photographs and documents that I can share on social media.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to stream audio and video files in my web browser.
Action: Stream Audio Files In Web Browser

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to see what a particular user has downloaded, so that I can track use of assets.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to make as much archival material as possible available for use, so that I can fulfill the RAC's mission.
Action: Possible Make As Much Archival Material

Text: #G26# As a researcher, I want to see common material across collections, so that so I can prepare a comprehensive analysis.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to search all files by keyword.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to upload inventories, so that our donor representatives have an easier time requesting their material.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to access the digital files on the X-drive, so that I can use them.
Action: Access The Digital Files On The Drive

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to have electronic versions of the collection files available for staff use, so that I increase accessibility and I do not lose the original files.
Action: Have Electronic Versions Of The Available Collection Files For Staff Use

Text: #G26# As a researcher, I want to have accurate cross-collection citation information, so that I can find materials again.
#G26# As a researcher, I want to search OCRed text in all available digitized textual documents, so that I can more efficiently locate digitized documents relevant to my research.
Action: Search Ocred Text In All Textual, Digitized, Available Documents

Text: #G26# As a researcher, I want to know the date on which something was digitized, so that I know if it's been digitized since I last looked.
Action: Know The Date On Which Something Digitized

Text: #G26# As an archivist, I want to search index cards and other non-public finding aids, so that I can provide better research assistance.
#G26# As an archivist, I want to access metadata and visual representations of index cards, so that I can use that information to assist researchers.
#G26# As an administrator, I want to assign rights to user groups or roles, so that I can control what users can and can't do.
#G26# As an administrator, I want to have researchers reset their own passwords, so that I don't have to send passwords in cleartext.
#G26# As an administrator, I want to limit who can see certain metadata fields, so that I can show or hide things from display based on user groups.
#G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to upload data to the repository and associate it with a publication, so that I receive attribution for my data as well as my publications.
Action: Associate The Repository With A Publication

Text: #G27# As a patron, I want to know which reports/datasets are coming out when, so that I can access latest report/dataset.
#G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to manage report/dataset name changes so patrons are able to find historic reports that have a different name from current report.

#G27# As a crossdeptprojteammember, I want to have a better place to collect and share project materials, with a range of organization/tagging and access options, including private (internal group use only), University and public.
Action: Have A Better Place With Option Including Internal Group Private Use
Have A Better Place With A Range Of Tagging
Have A Better Place With A Range Of Organization
Have A Better Place With Option Including Public
Have A Better Place With A Range Of Access
Have A Better Place With Option Including University

Text: #G27# As a patron, I want to view/upload content in multiple formats, including old formats such as Lotus Works.
Action: View Content In Multiple Formats Including Old Formats Such As Lotus Works
Upload Content In Multiple Formats Including Old Formats Such As Lotus Works

Text: #G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to login remotely to the repository using Shibboleth, so that I can get remote access to Cornell campus-only content.
Action: Login To The Using, Repository Shibboleth

Text: #G27# As a library staff member, I want to be able to tell the researchers I'm helping with DMPs that Cornell has a repository system I can use for archiving and sharing results of their research, so that I can easily meet the needs of funder DMP requirements.

#G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to create a collection for my documents, or my organization's documents, and apply some distinctive branding to that collection, so that I can promote my work, or that of my organization.
Action: Create A Collection For Organization's Document
Apply Some Distinctive Branding To That Collection

Text: #G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to easily find all the items in the repository that I have authored, by searching on my name (author name authority and/or identification issue), because I keeps my publications in the repository up-to-date and points people tithe repository.
Action: Find The Items In The Repository Searching On Name Identification
Find The Items In The Repository Searching On Name Or
Find The Items In The Repository Searching On Name Issue
Find The Items In The Repository Searching On Name Author Name Authority
Find The Items In The Repository Searching On Name

Text: #G27# As a researcher, I want to discover items in the repository through the library's discovery system and Google, so that I can facilitate my easy use of the content.
Action: Discover Items In The Repository Through The Library's Discovery System
Discover Items In The Repository Through Google

Text: #G27# As a researcher, I want to receive updates when new works are published in a given collection or by a given author, so that I can discover more of their work.
#G27# As an academicresearcher, I want to find the works of a particular author in one easily sortable spot, so that I can see the evolution of their scholarship over time.
Action: Find The Works Of A Particular Author In Easily Sortable Spot

Text: #G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to manage customizable relationship groups in support of patron see also option.
Action: Manage Customizable Relationship Groups In Support Of Patron Option

Text: #G27# As a library staff member, I want to make digital items held in trusted external system searchable within our system, so that I can provide seamless access to disparate collections.
Action: Make Digital Items In Searchable, External, Trusted System Within System

Text: #G27# As a student, I want to learn who at Cornell has or is engaged in research related to a particular topic, so that I can find an appropriate advisor, choose which courses to enroll in, and identify work/internship opportunities.
#G27# As a library staff member, I want to upload material to the repository on the author's behalf, so that I can fulfill a service obligation.
Action: Upload Material To The Repository On The Author's Behalf

Text: #G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to upload new version of report/dataset while retaining previous versions for patron use.
Action: Upload New Version Of Report Retaining Previous Versions For Patron Use

Text: #G27# As a repository support team member, I want to export a set of records and associated files, manipulate this data set, and reload into the system, because I am aware of a uniform error in a collection.
Action: Export A Set Of Associated File
Am Aware Of A Uniform Error In A Collection

Text: #G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to associate a researcherID or ORCID with a submission, so that there is no ambiguity between my work and someone else with the same name.
Action: Associate A Researcherid With A Submission

Text: #G27# As a library staff member, I want to have customizable metadata fields, so that each project is described in the most accurate way possible.
#G27# As a researcher, I want to promote/share my work through interactive maps, so that I can display the range and extent of my work graphically.

#G27# As an Extension Educator, I want to have a place to store a variety of documents, presentations and data sets I've created, that doesn't require an extra step in making available on my own County/Region/Project site (i.e. a list or directory of materials there is automatically updated when placed in a central archive/repository).
Action: Store A Variety Of Data Set

Text: #G27# As a patron, I want to know other reports/datasets that are related (e.g. see also) to report/dataset being viewed for the purpose finding other related information.

#G27# As a librarydiscoveryoperator, I want to harvest useful metadata from the repository via OAI, and continue to do so incrementally, so that I can make Cornell publications discoverable in my repository.
Action: Harvest Useful Metadata From The Repository Via Oai

Text: #G27# As a library staff member, I want to quickly correct errors in uploaded metadata, and even uploaded documents, while leaving a record of my revisions (and possibly the reasons behind them), so that I can present correct versions of content and to locate points of error.
Action: Correct Errors In Even Uploaded Document

Text: #G27# As a library staff member, I want to receive a quick response and a reasonable resolution to tech support issues, so that service can proceed with minimal interruption.
Action: Receive A Reasonable Resolution To Tech Support Issues

Text: #G27# As a Cornell faculty member, I want to share on the repository files that are larger than 1GB in a way that still allows users to download them if I want to use them, so that I can meet funder requirements.
Action: Share On The Repository Files Are Larger Than Gb In A Way Still Allows

Text: #G27# As a DB/IR administrator, I want to have a personal account with the ability to change passwords to make them more secure or to retrieve forgotten ones.
#G27# As a repository support team member, I want to move a collection, so that I can fulfill the collection owner's request.

#G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that the redundant copies are continuously monitored for unwanted changes, and that if/when changes do occur, there is a mechanism by which I can determine the original object and restore it to all copies.
Action: By Which Restore The Original Object To All Copies

Text: #G27# As a library staff member, I want to preserve both the content and the metadata within the repository in a robust manner, so that I can provide stable, long-term access to this material.
Action: Preserve The Content In A Robust Manner
Preserve The Metadata Within The Repository

Text: #G27# As an asset manager, I want to be assured that there is a formal plan for the disposition of assets if the IR should cease.
#G27# As an asset manager, I want to have mechanism to pass ownership/management of the assets to a successor.
Action: Pass Ownership Of The Assets To A Successor

Text: #G27# As a patron, I want to email system provider to report issues and ask questions.
